member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData
member.summary: An audio change to apply to the game's sound bank.
member.remarks: This describes an override applied to the sound bank. The override is applied permanently for the current game session, even if it's later removed from the data asset. Overriding a cue will reset all values to the ones specified.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.Id
member.summary: A unique cue ID, used when playing the sound in-game. The ID should only contain alphanumeric/underscore/dot characters. For custom audio cues, this should be prefixed with your mod ID like Example.ModId_AudioName.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.FilePaths
member.summary: A list of file paths (not asset names) from which to load the audio. These can be absolute paths or relative to the game's Content folder. Each file can be .ogg or .wav. If you list multiple paths, a random one will be chosen each time it's played.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.Category
member.summary: The audio category, which determines which volume slider in the game options applies. This should be one of Default, Music, Sound, Ambient, or Footsteps. Defaults to Default.

summary.para: Whether the audio should be streamed from disk when it's played, instead of being loaded into memory ahead of time. This is only possible for Ogg Vorbis (.ogg) files, which otherwise will be decompressed in-memory on load.
This is a tradeoff between memory usage and performance, so you should consider which value is best for each audio cue:

item.description: true: Reduces memory usage when the audio cue isn't active, but increases performance impact when it's played. Playing the audio multiple times will multiply the memory and performance impact while they're active, since each play will stream a new instance. Recommended for longer audio cues (like music or ambient noise), or cues that are rarely used in a specific scenario (e.g. a sound that only plays once in an event).

false: Increases memory usage (since it's fully loaded into memory), but reduces performance impact when it's played. It can be played any number of times without affecting memory or performance (it'll just play the cached audio). Recommended for sound effects, or short audio cues that are played occasionally.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.Looped
member.summary: Whether the audio cue loops continuously until stopped.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.UseReverb
member.summary: Whether to apply a reverb effect to the audio.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.AudioCueData.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.summary: The tile position relative to the top-left corner of the building where the upgrade sign will be placed when Robin is building an upgrade. Defaults to approximately (5, 1) if the building interior type is a shed, else (0, 0).

member.summary: The pixel height of the upgrade sign when Robin is building an upgrade.

member.summary: Whether the building should become semi-transparent when the player is behind it.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.SourceRect
member.summary: If set, the building's pixel area within the . Defaults to the entire texture.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.SeasonOffset
member.summary: A pixel offset to apply each season. This is applied to the position by multiplying the offset by 0 (spring), 1 (summer), 2 (fall), or 3 (winter). Default 0, so all seasons use the same source rect.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.DrawOffset
member.summary: A pixel offset applied to the building sprite's placement in the world.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.SortTileOffset
member.summary: A Y tile offset applied when figuring out render layering. For example, a value of 2.5 will treat the building as if it was 2.5 tiles further up the screen for the purposes of layering.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.CollisionMap
member.summary:
If set, an ASCII text block which indicates which of the building's tiles the players can walk onto, where each character can be X (blocked) or O (passable). Defaults to all tiles blocked. For example, a stable covers a 4x2 tile area with the front two tiles passable:
XXXX XOOX

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.AdditionalPlacementTiles
member.summary: The extra tiles to treat as part of the building when placing it through a construction menu, if any. For example, the farmhouse uses this to make sure the stairs are clear.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.BuildingType
member.summary: If set, the full name of the C# type to instantiate for the building instance. Defaults to a generic StardewValley.Building instance. Note that using a non-vanilla building type will cause a crash when trying to write the building to the save file.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.Builder
member.summary: The NPC from whom you can request construction. The vanilla values are Robin and Wizard, but you can specify a different name if a mod opens a construction menu for them. Defaults to Robin. If omitted, it won't appear in any menu.

member.summary: If set, a game state query which indicates whether the building should be available in the construction menu. Defaults to always available.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.BuildDays
member.summary: The number of days needed to complete construction (e.g. 1 for a building completed the next day). If set to 0, construction finishes instantly.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.BuildCost
member.summary: The gold cost to construct the building.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.BuildMaterials
member.summary: The materials you must provide to start construction.

member.summary: The ID of the building for which this is an upgrade, or omit to allow constructing it as a new building. For example, the Big Coop sets this to "Coop". Any numbers of buildings can be an upgrade for the same building, in which case the player can choose one upgrade path.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.MagicalConstruction
member.summary: Whether the building is magical. This changes the carpenter menu to a mystic theme while this building's blueprint is selected, and completes the construction instantly when placed.

member.summary: If set, the position and size of the door that animals use to enter/exit the building, if the building interior is an animal location. This is measured in tiles relative to the top-left corner tile. Defaults to disabled.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.AnimalDoorOpenDuration
member.summary: The duration of the open animation for the , measured in milliseconds. If omitted, the door switches to the open state instantly.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.AnimalDoorOpenSound
member.summary: If set, the sound which is played once each time the animal door is opened. Disabled by default.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.AnimalDoorCloseDuration
member.summary: The duration of the close animation for the , measured in milliseconds. If omitted, the door switches to the closed state instantly.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.AnimalDoorCloseSound
member.summary: If set, the sound which is played once each time the animal door is closed. Disabled by default.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.NonInstancedIndoorLocation
member.summary: If set, the name of the existing global location to treat as the building's interior, like FarmHouse and Greenhouse for their respective buildings. If omitted, each building will have its own location instance.

remarks.para: Each location can only be used by one building. If the location is already in use (e.g. because the player has two of this building), each subsequent building will use the and instead. For example, the first greenhouse will use the global Greenhouse location, and any subsequent greenhouse will use a separate instanced location.
The non-instanced location must already be in Game1.locations.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.IndoorMap
member.summary: The name of the map asset under Content/Maps to load for the building interior (like "Shed" for the Content/Maps/Shed map).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingData.IndoorMapType
member.summary: If set, the full name of the C# GameLocation subclass which will manage the building's interior location. This must be one of the vanilla types to avoid a crash when saving. Defaults to a generic GameLocation.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingDrawLayer.FrameDuration
member.summary: The number of milliseconds each animation frame is displayed on-screen before switching to the next, if is more than one.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingDrawLayer.FrameCount
member.summary: The number of animation frames to render. If this is more than one, the building will be animated automatically based on and .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingDrawLayer.FramesPerRow
member.summary: The number of animation frames per row in the spritesheet.
member.remarks:
For each frame, the will be offset by its width to the right up to - 1 times, and then down by its height. For example, if you set to 6 and to 3, the building will expect the frames to be laid out like this in the spritesheet (where frame 1 matches ):
1 2 3 4 5 6

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Buildings.BuildingDrawLayer.AnimalDoorOffset
member.summary: A pixel offset applied to the draw layer when the animal door is open. While the door is opening, the percentage open is applied to the offset (e.g. 50% open = 50% offset).

member.summary: A unique ID for this entry.

member.summary: The season when this appearance applies, or null for any season.

member.summary: Whether the appearance can be used when the NPC is indoors.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterAppearanceData.Outdoors
member.summary: Whether the appearance can be used when the NPC is outdoors.

member.summary: The asset name for the portrait texture, or null for the default portrait.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterAppearanceData.IsIslandAttire
member.summary: Whether this is island beach attire worn at the resort.
member.remarks: This is mutually exclusive: NPCs will never wear it in other contexts if it's true, and will never wear it as island attire if it's false.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterAppearanceData.Precedence
member.summary: The order in which this entry should be checked, where 0 is the default value used by most entries. Entries with the same precedence are checked in the order listed.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterAppearanceData.Weight
member.summary: If multiple entries with the same apply, the relative weight to use when randomly choosing one.
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData
member.summary: The content data for an NPC.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.DisplayName
member.summary: A tokenizable string for the NPC's display name.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.BirthSeason
member.summary: The season when the NPC was born.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.BirthDay
member.summary: The day when the NPC was born.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HomeRegion
member.summary: The region of the world in which the NPC lives (one of Desert, Town, or Other).
member.remarks: For example, only Town NPCs are counted for the introductions quest, can be selected as a secret santa for the Feast of the Winter Star, or get a friendship boost from the Luau.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Language
member.summary: The language spoken by the NPC.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Gender
member.summary: The character's gender identity.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Age
member.summary: The general age of the NPC.
member.remarks: This affects generated dialogue lines (e.g. a child might say "stupid" and an adult might say "depressing"), generic dialogue (e.g. a child might respond to dumpster diving with "Eww... What are you doing?" and a teen would say "Um... Why are you digging in the trash?"), and the gift they choose as Feast of the Winter Star gift-giver. Children are also excluded from item delivery quests.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Manner
member.summary: A measure of the character's general politeness.
member.remarks: This affects some generic dialogue lines.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SocialAnxiety
member.summary: A measure of the character's comfort with social situations.
member.remarks: This affects some generic dialogue lines.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Optimism
member.summary: A measure of the character's overall optimism.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.IsDarkSkinned
member.summary: Whether the NPC has dark skin, which affects the chance of children with the player having dark skin too.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanBeRomanced
member.summary: Whether players can date and marry this NPC.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.LoveInterest
member.summary: Unused.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Calendar
member.summary: How the NPC's birthday is shown on the calendar.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SocialTab
member.summary: How the NPC is shown on the social tab.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanSocialize
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether to enable social features (like birthdays, gift giving, friendship, and an entry in the social tab). Defaults to true (except for monsters, horses, pets, and Junimos).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanReceiveGifts
member.summary: Whether players can give gifts to this NPC. Default true.
member.remarks: The NPC must also be social per and have an entry in Data/NPCGiftTastes to receive gifts, regardless of this value.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanGreetNearbyCharacters
member.summary: Whether this NPC can show a speech bubble greeting nearby players or NPCs, and or be greeted by other NPCs. Default true.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanCommentOnPurchasedShopItems
member.summary: Whether this NPC can comment on items that a player sold to a shop which then resold it to them, or null to allow it if their is Town.
member.remarks: The NPC must also be social per to allow it, regardless of this value.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CanVisitIsland
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the NPC can visit Ginger Island once the resort is unlocked.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.IntroductionsQuest
member.summary: Whether to include this NPC in the introductions quest, or null to include them if their is Town.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.ItemDeliveryQuests
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether this NPC can give item delivery quests, or null to allow it if their is Town.
member.remarks: The NPC must also be social per to be included, regardless of this value.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.PerfectionScore
member.summary: Whether to include this NPC when checking whether the player has max friendships with every NPC for the perfection score.
member.remarks: The NPC must also be social per to be counted, regardless of this value.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.EndSlideShow
member.summary: How the NPC appears in the end-game perfection slide show.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseAdopts
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the player will need to adopt children with this spouse, instead of either the player or NPC giving birth. If null, defaults to true for same-gender and false for opposite-gender spouses.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseWantsChildren
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the spouse will ask to have children. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseGiftJealousy
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the spouse will get jealous when the player gifts items to another NPC of the same gender when it's not their birthday. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseGiftJealousyFriendshipChange
member.summary: The friendship change when applies.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseRoom
member.summary: The NPC's spouse room in the farmhouse when the player marries them.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpousePatio
member.summary: The NPC's patio area on the farm when the player marries them, if any.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseFloors
member.summary: The floor IDs which the NPC might randomly apply to the farmhouse when married, or an empty list to choose from the vanilla floors.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpouseWallpapers
member.summary: The wallpaper IDs which the NPC might randomly apply to the farmhouse when married, or an empty list to choose from the vanilla wallpapers.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.DumpsterDiveFriendshipEffect
member.summary: The friendship point change if this NPC sees a player rummaging through trash.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.DumpsterDiveEmote
member.summary: The emote ID to show above the NPC's head when they see a player rummaging through trash.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.FriendsAndFamily
member.summary: The NPC's closest friends and family, where the key is the NPC name and the value is an optional tokenizable string for the name to use in dialogue text (like 'mom').
member.remarks: This affects generic dialogue for revealing likes and dislikes to family members, and may affect inlaw_{NPC} dialogues. This isn't necessarily comprehensive.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.FlowerDanceCanDance
member.summary: Whether the NPC can be asked to dance at the Flower Dance festival. This can be true (can be asked even if not romanceable), false (can never ask), or null (true if romanceable).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.WinterStarGifts
member.summary: At the Winter Star festival, the possible gifts this NPC can give to players.
member.remarks: If this doesn't return a match, a generic gift is selected based on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.WinterStarParticipant
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether this NPC can give and receive gifts at the Feast of the Winter Star, or null to allow it if their is Town.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.UnlockConditions
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the NPC should be added to the world, checked when loading a save and when ending each day. This only affects whether the NPC is added when missing; returning false won't remove an NPC that's already been added.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.SpawnIfMissing
member.summary: Whether to add this NPC to the world automatically when they're missing and the match.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Home
member.summary: The possible locations for the NPC's default map. The first matching entry is used.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.TextureName
member.summary: The last segment of the NPC's portrait and sprite asset names when not set via . For example, set to "Abigail" to use Portraits/Abigail and Characters/Abigail respectively. Defaults to the internal NPC name.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Appearance
member.summary: The sprite and portrait texture to use, if set.

remarks.para: The appearances are sorted by , then filtered to those whose fields match. If multiple matching appearances have the highest precedence, one entry is randomly chosen based on their relative weight. This randomization is stable per day, so the NPC always makes the same choice until the next day.
If a portrait/sprite can't be loaded (or no appearances match), the NPC will use the default asset based on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.MugShotSourceRect
member.summary: The pixel area in the character's sprite texture to show as their mug shot in contexts like the calendar or social menu, or null for the first sprite in the spritesheet.
member.remarks: This should be approximately 16x24 pixels for best results.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the individual sprites in their world sprite spritesheet.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Breather
member.summary: Whether the chest on the NPC's world sprite puffs in and out as they breathe.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.BreathChestRect
member.summary: The pixel area within the spritesheet which expands and contracts to simulate breathing, relative to the top-left corner of the source rectangle for their current sprite, or null to calculate it automatically.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.BreathChestPosition
member.summary: The pixel offset to apply to the NPC's when drawn over the NPC, or null for the default offset.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow to draw, or null to apply the default options.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.EmoteOffset
member.summary: A pixel offset to apply to the character's default emote position.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.ShakePortraits
member.summary: The portrait indexes which should shake when displayed.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.KissSpriteIndex
member.summary: The sprite index within the to use when kissing a player.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.KissSpriteFacingRight
member.summary: Whether the character is facing right (true) or left (false) in their . The sprite will be flipped as needed to face the player.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HiddenProfileEmoteSound
member.summary: For the hidden gift log emote, the cue ID for the sound played when clicking the sprite. Defaults to drumkit6.
member.remarks: The hidden gift log emote happens when clicking on a character's sprite in the profile menu after earning enough hearts.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HiddenProfileEmoteDuration
member.summary: For the hidden gift log emote, how long the animation plays measured in milliseconds. Defaults to 4000 (4 seconds).
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HiddenProfileEmoteStartFrame
member.summary: For the hidden gift log emote, the index within the NPC's world sprite spritesheet at which the animation starts. If omitted for a vanilla NPC, the game plays a default animation specific to that NPC; if omitted for a custom NPC, the game just shows them walking while facing down.
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HiddenProfileEmoteFrameCount
member.summary: For the hidden gift log emote, the number of frames in the animation. The first frame corresponds to , and each subsequent frame will use the next sprite in the spritesheet. This has no effect if isn't set.
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.HiddenProfileEmoteFrameDuration
member.summary: For the hidden gift log emote, how long each animation frame is shown on-screen before switching to the next one, measured in milliseconds. This has no effect if isn't set.
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.FormerCharacterNames
member.summary: The former NPC names which may appear in save data.
member.remarks: If a NPC in save data has a name which (a) matches one of these values and (b) doesn't match the name of a loaded NPC, its data will be loaded into this NPC instead. If that happens, this will also update other references like friendship and spouse data.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.FestivalVanillaActorIndex
member.summary: The NPC's index in the Maps/characterSheet tilesheet, if applicable. This is used for placing vanilla NPCs in festivals from the map; custom NPCs should use the {layer}_additionalCharacters field in the festival data instead.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterData.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData
member.summary: As part of , a possible location for the NPC's default map.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData.Id
member.summary: An ID for this entry within the home list. This only needs to be unique within the current list.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData.Condition
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether this entry applies. Default true.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData.Location
member.summary: The internal name for the home location where this NPC spawns and returns each day.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData.Tile
member.summary: The tile position within the home location where this NPC spawns and returns each day.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterHomeData.Direction
member.summary: The default direction the NPC faces when they start each day. The possible values are down, left, right, and up.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterShadowData
member.summary: As part of , configures how the NPC's shadow should be rendered.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterShadowData.Visible
member.summary: Whether the shadow should be drawn.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterShadowData.Offset
member.summary: A pixel offset applied to the shadow position.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterShadowData.Scale
member.summary: The scale at which to draw the shadow.
member.remarks: This is a multiplier applied to the default shadow scale, which can change based on factors like whether the NPC is jumping. For example, 0.5 means half the size it'd be drawn if you didn't specify a scale.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Characters.CharacterSpousePatioData

member.summary: The spouse's animation frames when they're in the patio. Each frame is a tuple containing the [0] frame index and [1] optional duration in milliseconds (default 100). If omitted or empty, the NPC won't be animated.

member.summary: The default value for .

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData

member.summary: The seasons in which this crop can grow.

member.summary: The number of days in each visual step of growth before the crop is harvestable.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.RegrowDays
member.summary: The number of days before the crop regrows after harvesting, or -1 if it can't regrow.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.IsRaised
member.summary: Whether this is a raised crop on a trellis that can't be walked through.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.IsPaddyCrop
member.summary: Whether this crop can be planted near water for a unique paddy dirt texture, faster growth time, and auto-watering.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.NeedsWatering
member.summary: Whether this crop needs to be watered to grow.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.PlantableLocationRules
member.summary: The rules which override which locations the crop can be planted in, if applicable. These don't override more specific checks (e.g. crops needing to be planted in dirt).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestItemId
member.summary: The unqualified item ID produced when this crop is harvested.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMinStack
member.summary: The minimum number of to harvest.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMaxStack
member.summary: The maximum number of to harvest, before and are applied.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMaxIncreasePerFarmingLevel
member.summary: The number of extra harvests to produce per farming level. This is rounded down to the nearest integer and added to .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.ExtraHarvestChance
member.summary: The probability that harvesting the crop will produce extra harvest items, as a value between 0 (never) and 0.9 (nearly always). This is repeatedly rolled until it fails, then the number of successful rolls is added to the produced count.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMethod
member.summary: How the crop can be harvested.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMinQuality
member.summary: If set, the minimum quality of the harvest crop.
member.remarks: These fields set a constraint that's applied after the quality is calculated normally, they don't affect the initial quality logic.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.HarvestMaxQuality
member.summary: If set, the maximum quality of the harvest crop.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.TintColors
member.summary: The tint colors that can be applied to the crop sprite, if any. If multiple colors are listed, one is chosen at random for each crop. These can be MonoGame color field names (like ForestGreen), RGB hex codes (like #AABBCC), or RGBA hex codes (like #AABBCCDD).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.Texture
member.summary: The asset name for the crop texture under the game's Content folder.

member.summary: The index of this crop in the (one crop per row).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Crops.CropData.CountForPolyculture
member.summary: Whether the player must ship 15 of this crop's harvest item to unlock the polyculture achievement.

member.summary: The tool ID with which produced items can be collected from the animal, if the is set to . The values recognized by the vanilla tools are MilkPail and Shears. Default none.

member.summary: The minimum friendship points needed to reduce the by one. Defaults to no reduction.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FarmAnimals.FarmAnimalData.DeluxeProduceMinimumFriendship
member.summary: The minimum friendship points needed to produce the .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FarmAnimals.FarmAnimalData.DeluxeProduceCareDivisor
member.summary: A divisor which reduces the probability of producing . Lower values produce deluxe items more often.
member.remarks:
This is applied using this formula:
if happiness > 200: happiness_modifier = happiness * 1.5 else if happiness > 100: happiness_modifier = 0 else happiness_modifier = happiness - 100
((friendship + happiness_modifier) / DeluxeProduceCareDivisor) + (daily_luck * DeluxeProduceLuckMultiplier)
For example, given a friendship of 102 and happiness of 150, the probability with the default field values will be ((102 + 0) / 1200) + (daily_luck * 0) = (102 / 1200) = 0.085 or 8.5%.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FarmAnimals.FarmAnimalData.DeluxeProduceLuckMultiplier
member.summary: A multiplier which increases the bonus from daily luck on the probability of producing .
member.remarks: See remarks on .

member.summary: Whether players can feed this animal a golden cracker to double its normal output.

member.summary: The internal ID of a profession which makes it easier to befriend this animal. Defaults to none.

member.summary: The internal ID of a profession which increases the chance of higher-quality produce.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FarmAnimals.FarmAnimalData.ProfessionForFasterProduce
member.summary: The internal ID of a profession which reduces the by one. Defaults to none.

member.summary: The initial health points for a fence when it's first placed, which affects how quickly it degrades. A fence loses 1/1440 points per in-game minute (roughly 0.04 points per hour or 0.5 points for a 12-hour day).

member.summary: A list of tool IDs which can be used to break the fence, matching the keys in the Data\Tools asset.

member.summary: The context tags for the fish item to configure. If this lists multiple context tags, an item must match all of them. If an item matches multiple entries, the first entry which matches is used.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.FloorsAndPaths.FloorPathConnectType
member.summary: When drawing adjacent flooring items across multiple tiles, how the flooring sprite for each tile is selected.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FloorsAndPaths.FloorPathConnectType.Path

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.FloorsAndPaths.FloorPathConnectType.Random

member.summary: The items to produce when this giant crop is broken. All matching items will be produced.

member.summary: The asset name for the texture containing the giant crop's sprite.

member.summary: The top-left pixel position of the sprite within the . Defaults to (0, 0).

member.summary: The area in tiles occupied by the giant crop. This affects both its sprite size (which should be 16 pixels per tile) and the grid of crops needed for it to grow. Note that giant crops are drawn with an extra tile's height.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.GiantCrops.GiantCropData.Health
member.summary: The health points that must be depleted to break the giant crop. The number of points depleted per axe chop depends on the axe power level.

member.summary: The percentage chance a given grid of crops will grow into the giant crop each night, as a value between 0 (never) and 1 (always).

member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether the giant crop can be selected. Defaults to always enabled.

member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.summary: As part of , a possible item to produce when it's harvested.

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.GiantCrops.GiantCropHarvestItemData.Chance
member.summary: The probability that the item will be produced, as a value between 0 (never) and 1 (always).

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.GiantCrops.GiantCropHarvestItemData.ForShavingEnchantment
member.summary: Whether to drop this item only for the Shaving enchantment (true), only when the giant crop is broken (false), or both (null).

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.GiantCrops.GiantCropHarvestItemData.ScaledMinStackWhenShaving
member.summary: If set, the minimum stack size when this item is dropped due to the Shaving enchantment, scaled to the tool's power level.

remarks.para: This value is multiplied by the health deducted by the tool hit which triggered the enchantment. For example, an iridium tool that reduced the giant crop's health by 3 points will produce three times this value per hit.

If the scaled min and max are both set, the stack size is randomized between them. If only one is set, it's applied as a limit after the generic fields. If neither is set, the generic fields are applied as usual without scaling.

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.GiantCrops.GiantCropHarvestItemData.ScaledMaxStackWhenShaving
member.summary: If set, the maximum stack size when this item is dropped due to the Shaving enchantment, scaled to the tool's power level.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.HomeRenovations.RenovationValue
member.summary: As part of , a renovation requirement or action.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.HomeRenovations.RenovationValue.Type
member.summary: The requirement or action type. This can be Mail (check/change a mail flag for the current player) or Value (check/set a C# field on the farmhouse instance).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.HomeRenovations.RenovationValue.Key
member.summary: The mail flag (if is Mail) or field name (if is Value) to check or set.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.HomeRenovations.RenovationValue.Value
member.summary:
The effect of this field depends on whether this is used in or , and the value of :
For a renovation requirement:
If the is Mail, either "0" (player must not have the flag) or "1" (player must have it).
If the is Value, the required field value. This can be prefixed with ! to require any value except this one.
For a renovate action:
If the is Mail, either "0" (remove the mail flag) or "1" (add it).
If the is Value, either the integer value to set, or the exact string "selected" to set it to the index of the applied renovation.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData
member.summary: An incoming phone call that the player can receive when they have a telephone.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.TriggerCondition
member.summary: If set, a game state query which indicates whether to trigger this phone call.
member.remarks: Whether a player receives this call depends on two fields: is checked on the host player before sending the call to all players, then is checked on each player to determine whether the phone rings for them.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.RingCondition
member.summary: If set, a game state query which indicates whether the phone will ring when this call is received.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.FromNpc
member.summary: The internal name of the NPC making the call. If specified, that NPC's name and portrait will be shown.
member.remarks: To show a portrait and NPC name, you must specify either or ; otherwise a simple dialogue with no portrait/name will be shown.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.FromPortrait
member.summary: If set, overrides the portrait shown based on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.FromDisplayName
member.summary: If set, overrides the NPC display name shown based on .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.Dialogue
member.summary: A tokenizable string for the call text.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.IgnoreBaseChance
member.summary: Whether to ignore the base chance of receiving a call for this call.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.SimpleDialogueSplitBy
member.summary: If set, marks this as a simple dialogue box without an NPC name and portrait, with lines split into multiple boxes by this substring. For example, using # will split Box A#Box B#Box C into three consecutive dialogue boxes.
member.remarks: You should leave this null in most cases, and use the regular dialogue format in to split lines if needed. This is mainly intended to support some older vanilla phone calls.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.MaxCalls
member.summary: The maximum number of times this phone call can be received, or -1 for no limit.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.IncomingPhoneCallData.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.summary: Changes to apply to the .

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData
member.summary: A world area which groups multiple in-game locations with shared settings and metadata.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.SeasonOverride
member.summary: The season which is always active for locations within this context. For example, setting will make it always summer there regardless of the calendar season. If not set, the calendar season applies.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.DefaultMusic
member.summary: The cue ID for the music to play when the player is in the location, unless overridden by a Music map property. Despite the name, this has a higher priority than the seasonal music fields like . Ignored if omitted.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.DefaultMusicCondition

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.CopyWeatherFromLocation
member.summary: The ID of the location context from which to inherit weather, if any. If this is set, the field is ignored.

summary.para: When the player gets knocked out in combat, the locations where they can wake up. If multiple locations match, the first match will be used. If none match, the player will wake up at Harvey's clinic.

If the selected location has a standard event with the exact key PlayerKilled, that event will play when the player wakes up and the game will apply the lost items or gold logic. The game won't track this event, so it'll repeat each time the player is revived. If there's no such event, the player will wake up without an event, and no items or gold will be lost.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.MaxPassOutCost
member.summary: When the player passes out (due to exhaustion or at 2am) in this context, the maximum amount of gold lost. If set to -1, uses the same value as the default context.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.PassOutMail
member.summary: When the player passes out (due to exhaustion or at 2am) in this context, the possible letters to add to their mailbox (if they haven't received it before).
member.remarks: If multiple letters are valid, one will be chosen randomly (unless one of them specifies ).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.PassOutLocations
member.summary: When the player passes out (due to exhaustion or at 2am), the locations where they can wake up.

remarks.para: If multiple locations match, the first match will be used. If none match, the player will wake up in their bed at home.
The selected location must either have a bed or the AllowWakeUpWithoutBed: true map property, otherwise the player will be warped home instead.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.LocationContextData.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.summary: As part of , a letter added to the player's mailbox when they pass out (due to exhaustion or at 2am).

member.summary: A unique string ID for this entry within the current location context.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.PassOutMailData.Condition
member.summary: A game state query which indicates whether this entry is active. Defaults to always true.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.PassOutMailData.Mail
member.summary: The letter ID to add.

remarks.para: The game will look for an existing letter ID in the Data/mail asset in this order (where {billed} is Billed if they lost gold or NotBilled otherwise, and {gender} is Female or Male): {letter id}_{billed}_{gender}, {letter id}_{billed}, {letter id}. If no match is found, the game will send passedOut2 instead.
If the mail ID starts with passedOut, {0} in the letter text will be replaced with the gold amount lost, and the letter won't appear on the collections tab.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.LocationContexts.PassOutMailData.MaxPassOutCost
member.summary: The maximum amount of gold lost. This is applied after the context's (i.e. the context's value is used to calculate the random amount, then this field caps the result). Defaults to unlimited.

member.summary: The former location names which may appear in save data.
member.remarks: If a location in save data has a name which (a) matches one of these values and (b) doesn't match the name of a loaded location, its data will be loaded into this location instead.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.LocationData.CanPlantHere
member.summary: Whether crops and trees can be planted and grown here by default, unless overridden by their plantable rules. If omitted, defaults to true on the farm and false elsewhere.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.LocationData.CanHaveGreenRainSpawns
member.summary: Whether green rain trees and debris can spawn here by default.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.LocationData.ArtifactSpots
member.summary: The items that can be found when digging artifact spots in the location.

remarks.para: The items that can be dug up in a location are decided by combining this field with the one from the Default entry, sorting them by , and taking the first drop whose fields match. Items with the same precedence are checked in the order listed.
For consistency, vanilla artifact drops prefer using these precedence values:

item.description: -1000: location items which should override the global priority items (e.g. fossils on Ginger Island);
-100: global priority items (e.g. Qi Beans);
0: normal items;
100: global fallback items (e.g. clay).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.LocationData.FishAreas
member.summary: The distinct fishing areas within the location.
member.remarks: These can be referenced by via , and determine which fish are collected by crab pots.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.LocationData.Fish
member.summary: The items that can be found by fishing in the location.

remarks.para: The items to catch in a location are decided by combining this field with the one from the Default entry, sorting them by , and taking the first fish whose fields match. Items with the same precedence are shuffled randomly.
For consistency, vanilla fish prefer precedence values in these ranges:

item.description: -1100 to -1000: global priority items (e.g. Qi Beans);
-200 to -100: unique location items (e.g. legendary fish or secret items);
-50 to -1: normal high-priority items;
0: normal items;
1 to 100: normal low-priority items;
1000+: global fallback items (e.g. trash).

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.SpawnFishData
member.summary: As part of , an item that can be found by fishing in the location.
member.remarks:
Fish spawns have a few special constraints:
Only one fish can be produced at a time. If this uses an item query which returns multiple items, one will be chosen at random.
This must return an item of type StardewValley.Object or one of its subclasses.
Entries using an item query (instead of an item ID) are ignored for the fishing TV channel hints.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.SpawnForageData
member.summary: As part of , a forage object that can spawn in the location.
member.remarks:
Forage spawns have a few special constraints:
Only one item can be produced at a time. If this uses an item query which returns multiple items, one will be chosen at random.
If this returns a null or non-StardewValley.Object item, the game will skip that spawn opportunity (and log a warning for a non-null invalid item type).
The field is checked once right before spawning forage, to build the list of possible forage spawns. It's not checked again for each forage spawn; use the instead for per-spawn probability.

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.SpawnForageData.Chance
member.summary: The probability that the forage will spawn if it's selected, as a value between 0 (never) and 1 (always). If this check fails, that spawn opportunity will be skipped.

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.Locations.SpawnForageData.Season
member.summary: If set, the specific season when the forage should apply. For more complex conditions, see .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Machines.MachineData.InteractMethod
member.summary: A C# method invoked when the player interacts with the machine while it doesn't have output ready to harvest.
member.remarks: This is an advanced field. Most machines shouldn't use this. This must be specified in the form {full type name}: {method name} (like StardewValley.Object, Stardew Valley: SomeInteractMethod). The method must be static, take three arguments (Object machine, GameLocation location, Farmer player), and return a boolean indicating whether the interaction succeeded.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Machines.MachineData.PreventTimePass

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Machines.MachineData.ReadyTimeModifiers

member.remarks: If multiple entries match, they'll be applied sequentially (e.g. two matching rules to double processing time will quadruple it).

member.summary: Whether this machine acts as an incubator when placed in a building, so players can incubate eggs in it.
member.remarks: This is used by the incubator and ostrich incubator. The game logic assumes there's only one such machine in each building, so this generally shouldn't be used by custom machines that can be built in a vanilla barn or coop.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Machines.MachineItemOutput
member.summary: As part of a , an item produced by this machine.
member.remarks: Only one item can be produced at a time. If this uses an item query which returns multiple items, one will be chosen at random.

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.Machines.MachineItemOutput.OutputMethod
member.summary: A C# method which produces the item to output.

remarks.para: This is an advanced field. Most machines shouldn't use this. This must be specified in the form {full type name}: {method name} (like StardewValley.Object, Stardew Valley: OutputSolarPanel). The method must be static, take five arguments (Object machine, GameLocation location, Farmer player, Item? inputItem, bool probe), and return the Item instance to output. If this method returns null, the machine won't output anything.
If set, the other fields which change the output item (like or ) are ignored.

member.remarks: For vanilla machines, this is used by casks to set the AgingMultiplier for each item.

member.summary: The language code for this localization. This should ideally be an ISO 639-1 code, with only letters and hyphens.

member.summary: The asset name for a 174x78 pixel texture containing the button of the language for language selection menu. The top half of the sprite is the default state, while the bottom half is the hover state.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.UseLatinFont
member.summary: Whether the language uses the game's default fonts. Set to false to enable a custom font via and .

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.FontFile
member.summary: If is false, the asset name for the custom BitMap font.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.FontPixelZoom
member.summary: If is false, a factor by which to multiply the font size. The recommended baseline is 1.5, but you can adjust it to make your text smaller or bigger in-game.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.FontApplyYOffset
member.summary: Whether to shift the font up by four pixels (multiplied by the if applicable), to better align languages with larger characters like Chinese and Japanese.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.SmallFontLineSpacing
member.summary: The line spacing value used by the game's smallFont font.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.UseGenderedCharacterTranslations
member.summary: Whether the social tab and gift log will use gender-specific translations (like the vanilla Portuguese language).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.NumberComma
member.summary: The string to use as the thousands separator (like "," for 5,000,000).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.TimeFormat
member.summary: A string which describes the in-game time format, with tokens replaced by in-game values. For example, [HOURS_12]:[MINUTES] [AM_PM] would show "12:00 PM" at noon.
member.remarks:
The valid tokens are:
[HOURS_12]: hours in 12-hour format, where midnight and noon are both "12".
[HOURS_12_0]: hours in 12-hour format, where midnight and noon are both "0".
[HOURS_24]: hours in 24-hour format, where midnight is "0" and noon is "12".
[HOURS_24_0]: hours in 24-hour format with zero-padding, where midnight is "00" and noon is "12".
[MINUTES]: minutes with zero-padding.
[AM_PM]: the localized text for "am" or "pm". The game shows "pm" between noon and 11:59pm inclusively, else "am".

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.ClockTimeFormat
member.summary: A string which describes the in-game time format. Equivalent to , but used for the in-game clock.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.ModLanguage.ClockDateFormat
member.summary: A string which describes the in-game date format as shown in the in-game clock, with tokens replaced by in-game values. For example, [DAY_OF_WEEK] [DAY_OF_MONTH] would show Mon 1.
member.remarks:
The valid tokens are:
[DAY_OF_WEEK]: the translated, abbreviated day of week.
[DAY_OF_MONTH]: the numerical day of the month.

member.summary: The metadata for a movie that can play at the movie theater.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieData.Id
member.summary: A key which uniquely identifies this movie. This should only contain alphanumeric/underscore/dot characters. For custom movies, this should be prefixed with your mod ID like Example.ModId_MovieName.

member.summary: The seasons when the movie plays, or none to allow any season.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieData.YearModulus
member.summary: If set, the movie is available when {year} % == (where {year} is the number of years since the movie theater was built and {remainder} defaults to zero). For example, a modulus of 2 with remainder 1 is shown in the second year and every other year thereafter.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieData.Texture
member.summary: The asset name for the movie poster and screen images, or null to use LooseSprites\Movies.
member.remarks: This must be a spritesheet with one 490×128 pixel row per movie. A 13×19 area in the top-left corner of the row should contain the movie poster. With a 16-pixel offset from the left edge, there should be two rows of five 90×61 pixel movie screen images, with a six-pixel gap between each image. (The movie doesn't need to use all of the image slots.)

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieReaction
member.summary: As part of , a possible reactions to movies matching a tag.

summary.para: A pattern which determines which movies this reaction can apply to.
This can be any of the following:

item.description: "*" to match any movie.
A tag to match any movie which has that tag in its list.
An ID to match any movie with that value.

How much the NPC enjoys this movie, based on the for matched entries. This performs a two-pass check: any entry which matches with a non-response is used to determine the NPC's response, defaulting to like. The result is then checked against this value.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieReaction.Response
member.summary: How much the NPC enjoys the movie (one of love, like, or dislike).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieReaction.Whitelist
member.summary: A list of internal NPC names. If this isn't empty, at least one of these NPCs must be present in the theater for this reaction to apply.

member.summary: If set, possible dialogue from the NPC during the movie.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Movies.MovieReaction.Id
member.summary: A key which uniquely identifies this movie reaction. This should only contain alphanumeric/underscore/dot characters. For custom movie reactions, this should be prefixed with your mod ID like Example.ModId_ReactionName.

The internal names for NPCs watching the movie.

member.summary: The context tag for the items to require.

member.summary: The minimum number of items matching the that must be donated.

member.name: T:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards
member.summary: The data for a set of artifacts that can be donated to the museum, and the resulting reward.

summary.para: The items that must be donated to complete this reward group. The player must fulfill every entry in the list to unlock the reward. For example, an entry with the tag forage_item and count 2 will require donating any two forage items.
Special case: an entry with the exact values Tag: "", Count: -1 passes if the museum is complete (i.e. the player has donated the max number of items).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.RewardItemId
member.summary: The qualified item ID for the item given to the player when they donate all required items for this group. There's no reward item if omitted.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.RewardItemCount
member.summary: The stack size for the item (if the item supports stacking).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.RewardItemIsSpecial
member.summary: Whether to mark the item as a special permanent item, which can't be destroyed/dropped and can only be collected once.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.RewardItemIsRecipe
member.summary: Whether to give the player a cooking/crafting recipe which produces the item, instead of the item itself. Ignored if the item type can't be cooked/crafted (i.e. non-object-type items).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.RewardActions
member.summary: The actions to perform when the reward is collected. For example, this is used for the rusty key unlock at 60 donations.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.FlagOnCompletion
member.summary: Whether to add the ID value to the player's received mail. This is used to track whether the player has collected the reward, and should almost always be true. If this and are both false, the player will be able to collect the reward infinite times.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Museum.MuseumRewards.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields ignored by the base game, for use by mods.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.MusicContext.SubLocation
member.remarks: Confusingly, has a higher MusicContext value than , but is used when figuring out what song to play in split-screen. Songs with this value are prioritized above ambient noises, but below other instances' default songs -- so this should be used for things like specialized ambient music.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Objects.ObjectData.Edibility
member.summary: A numeric value that determines how much energy (edibility × 2.5) and health (edibility × 1.125) is restored when this item is eaten. An item with an edibility of -300 can't be eaten, values from -299 to -1 reduce health and energy, and zero can be eaten but doesn't change health/energy.
member.remarks: This is ignored for rings.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Objects.ObjectData.IsDrink
member.summary: Whether to drink the item instead of eating it.
member.remarks: Ignored if the item isn't edible per .

member.summary: The buffs to apply to the player when this item is eaten, if any.
member.remarks: Ignored if the item isn't edible per .

member.summary: If set, the item will drop a default item when broken as a geode. If is set too, there's a 50% chance of choosing a value from that list instead.

member.summary: The percentage chance that the pet sleeps on the player's bed at night, as a decimal value between 0 (never) and 1 (always).
member.remarks: The chances are checked in this order: , , and . The first match is used. If none match, the pet will choose a random empty spot in the farmhouse; if there's no empty spot, it'll sleep next to its pet bowl outside.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Pets.PetData.Behaviors
member.summary: The pet's possible actions and behaviors, defined as the states in a state machine. Essentially the pet will be in one state at any given time, which also determines which state they can transition to next. For example, a cat can transition from Walk to BeginSitDown, but it can't skip instantly from Walk to SitDownLick.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.SpecialOrders.SpecialOrderData.RandomizedElements
member.summary: The randomized tokens which can be referenced by other special order fields.

remarks.para: These can be used in some special order fields (noted in their code docs) in the form {Name} (like {FishType}), which returns the element's value.
If a randomized element selects an item, you can use the {Name:ValueType} form (like {FishType:Text}) to get a value related to the selected item:

item.description: Text: the item's translated display name.
TextPlural: equivalent to Text but pluralized if possible.
TextPluralCapitalized: equivalent to Text but pluralized if possible and its first letter capitalized.
Tags: a context tag which identifies the item, like id_o_128 for a pufferfish.
Price: for objects only, the gold price for selling this item to a store (all other item types will have the value 1).

member.summary: How far the target is pushed when hit, as a multiplier relative to a base weapon like the Rusty Sword (e.g. 1.5 for 150% of Rusty Sword's weight).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.Speed

member.summary: Reduces damage received by the player.

member.summary: The weapon type. One of 0 (stabbing sword), 1 (dagger), 2 (club or hammer), or 3 (slashing sword).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.MineBaseLevel
member.summary: The base mine level used to determine when this weapon appears in mine containers.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.MineMinLevel
member.summary: The min mine level used to determine when this weapon appears in mine containers.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.AreaOfEffect
member.summary: Slightly increases the area of effect.

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.CritChance
member.summary: The chance of a critical hit, as a decimal value between 0 (never) and 1 (always).

member.name: F:StardewValley.GameData.Weapons.WeaponData.CritMultiplier
member.summary: A multiplier applied to the base damage for a critical hit.

member.summary: The percentage chance each day that the tree will plant a seed on a nearby tile, as a value from 0 (never) to 1 (always). This only applied in locations where trees drop seeds (e.g. farms in vanilla).

member.summary: The percentage chance that a seed will drop when the player chops down the tree, as a value from 0 (never) to 1 (always).

member.summary: The location name to which this world position applies. Any location within the mines and the Skull Cavern will be Mines and SkullCave respectively, and festivals use the map asset name (e.g. Town-EggFestival).

member.summary: A list of location names in which this world position applies (see for details).

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.WorldMaps.WorldMapAreaPositionData.TileArea
member.summary: The tile area for the zone within the in-game location, or an empty rectangle for the entire map.
member.remarks: and are used to calculate the position of a player within the map view, given their real position in-game. For example, let's say an area has tile positions (0, 0) through (10, 20), and map pixel positions (200, 200) through (300, 400). If the player is standing on tile (5, 10) in-game (in the exact middle of the location), the game would place their marker at pixel (250, 300) on the map (in the exact middle of the map area).

member.name: P:StardewValley.GameData.WorldMaps.WorldMapAreaPositionData.ExtendedTileArea
member.summary: The tile area within which the player is considered to be within the zone, even if they're beyond the . Positions outside the will be snapped to the nearest valid position.

member.summary: The pixel coordinates for the image area on the map.
